title._content: Monadnock Mountain House in Jaffrey, New Hampshire

description._content: TITLE Monadnock Mountain House in Jaffrey, New Hampshire CREATOR French, J.A., Keene NH SUBJECT Buildings - NH Monadnock, Mount (N.H.) Hotels - NH DESCRIPTION Photograph of the Mountain House, also called the Halfway House, half way up Mount Monadnock, located in Cheshire County, New Hampshire. The original Mountain House was built in 1858 . In 1861, a two story house was added to the original stone structure by Moses Cudworth of Rindge NH. He also built a wagon shed and would stable the horses of people who rode up and then hiked the rest of the way. George and Abbie Rice acquired the site in 1866 and opened a much larger 3 story hotel, which burned down that year. New owners in 1868 built a two story building. After several more ownership changes, another owner changed the name to Half Way House in 1916. It was bought by a local association in 1945 and operated as a public property until it burned to the ground in 1954. PUBLISHER Keene Public Library and the Historical Society of Cheshire County DATE DIGITAL 20100120 DATE ORIGINAL 1870-1890? RESOURCE TYPE photographs FORMAT image/jpg RESOURCE IDENTIFIER HS396-P4423 RIGHTS MANAGEMENT No known copyright restrictions.
